title: Does police have any role or duty under PWDVA, 2005 in a case of domestic violence?
content:
Yes duties of police with respect to PWDVA are as follows:

**As soon as a complaint is received, Police has to inform aggrieved persons (Section 5):**

 - Of her right to make application to the PO

 - Of the availability of Service Providers

 - Of the availability of Protection Officers

 - Of her right to free legal services from Legal services Authority

 - Of her right to file a complaint u/s 498A IPC

 - Of her right to initiate criminal proceedings by lodging FIR

 - If the aggrieved person doesn't want to initiate criminal proceedings, make a general diary entry at the PS that complainant wants to pursue civil remedy.

 - Assist the victim in making the Domestic Incident Report (DIR)

 - Assist in implementation of protection order if directed by the court

 - DIR copies made by PO to be sent to the officer in charge of Police Station (Sec.9)

 - Rule 15(5) Rescue of aggrieved person by PO with help of local police.
